summary: The Expanding Head Start Eligibility Act of 2025 aims to amend the Head Start Act to broaden eligibility for the program. The bill proposes including recipients of Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF), Supplemental Security Income (SSI), Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP), Women, Infants, and Children (WIC), and federal housing assistance as qualifying for Head Start benefits. This expansion intends to reach more low-income families and children.
